Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘Skyline Sugar’ offers an explosive, sugary sweetness with a clean, crisp crunch. The pods are plump, brightly green, and virtually stringless, encasing tender, well-developed peas. The entire pod is edible at any stage. The plant itself is a architectural wonder, forming a narrow, upright column of foliage that reaches 40-45 cm in height and is densely packed with pods held conveniently out in the open for easy picking.

2. The Ultimate Snack and Stir-fry Pea This pea’s perfect texture and sugary taste make it incredibly versatile, shining both raw and cooked.

  • Garden-Side Snacking: The ultimate raw treat, eaten straight from the plant. Its thick, juicy walls provide an unparalleled crunchy-sweet experience.
  • Salads and Crudité: A star ingredient in salads, adding a burst of sweetness and colour, or served whole on a vegetable platter.
  • Stir-fries and Sautés: Its robust pod structure holds up beautifully to quick, high-heat cooking, retaining a vibrant colour and satisfying snap while absorbing savoury sauces.
  • Quick-Pickled: Can be lightly pickled in a sweet brine to create a crisp, refreshing refrigerator pickle.

3. The Harvest and Yield ‘Skyline Sugar’ is a concentrated, determinate-type producer, yielding its main crop over a generous 3-4 week period. For the best flavour and texture, harvest pods when they are plump and glossy but before the peas inside become overly prominent. Supplied as an RFID seed tape, a single planting provides a bountiful and convenient yield of 30-50 crisp pods per plant, with the first harvest ready in approximately 60 days from sowing.
